item.title: 大举做空特斯拉的对冲基金受到巨幅反弹的冲击
item.description: 在电动汽车制造商特斯拉公司公布一组数据引发股价大幅反弹之前，对冲基金大举做空特斯拉。【原文：Hedge funds piled into short bets against Tesla Inc. right before the electric vehicle maker unveiled a set of numbers that triggered a hefty share-price rally.】

item.title: 日本与菲律宾将签署重要军事协定
item.description: 日本和菲律宾将于周一签署一项协议，为两国军事互访提供便利，这两个美国盟国将在与中国的紧张关系中加强防务关系。【原文：Japan and the Philippines are set to sign on Monday an agreement that would facilitate mutual military visits, as the US allies tighten their defense ties amid tensions with China.】

item.title: 政府改革推动新兴市场债券市场实现最大回报
item.description: 债券投资者发出的信号是，在新兴市场，良好的政府比货币政策更重要。【原文：Bond investors are signaling that good government counts for more than monetary policy in emerging markets.】

item.title: 阿尔及利亚与意大利公司签署 4.55 亿美元农业项目协议
item.description: 阿尔及利亚和意大利公司 Bonifiche Ferraresi SpA 达成了一项 4.2 亿欧元（4.55 亿美元）的协议，以开发一个农业项目，因为这个北非国家希望提高粮食安全。【原文：Algeria and Italian firm Bonifiche Ferraresi SpA made a €420 million ($455 million) deal to develop an agricultural project, as the North African nation looks to boost food security.】

item.title: 津巴布韦拥有 3.7 亿美元的货币储备：邮件
item.description: 国营的《星期日邮报》援引津巴布韦中央银行行长约翰-穆沙亚万胡的话报道说，过去三个月来，支持津巴布韦新货币的现金和矿产储备已从 2.85 亿美元增至约 3.7 亿美元。【原文：Cash and mineral reserves backing Zimbabwe’s new currency have risen to approximately $370 million from $285 million over the past three months, the state-run Sunday Mail reported citing central bank governor John Mushayavanhu.】

item.title: 中国人民银行连续第二个月暂停购买黄金
item.description: 6 月份，中国央行连续第二个月没有购买黄金，贵金属从历史高位回落。【原文：China’s central bank didn’t buy any gold for a second month in June, as the precious metal edged lower from a record high.】

item.title: 桑托斯老板争分夺秒建造天然气巨无霸
item.description: 凯文-加拉格尔正在与时间赛跑。【原文：Kevin Gallagher is in a race against time.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔在通胀和招聘降温之际作证
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）可能会告诉立法者，美联储官员需要进一步确认通胀正在放缓，然后才能降息，即使有证据表明经济增长和就业正在放缓。【原文：Jerome Powell is likely to tell lawmakers that Federal Reserve officials need further confirmation inflation is slowing before they’re in a position to cut interest rates, even with evidence building of softer growth and employment.】

item.title: 西非军政府组建联盟，与地区集团决裂
item.description: 马里、尼日尔和布基纳法索的军事领导人进一步远离西非邻国，组建了一个旨在加强政治和经济一体化的联盟。【原文：Military leaders from Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso inched further away from their West African neighbors, forming a confederation aimed at reinforcing political and economic integration.】

item.title: 私人信贷基金 "不参与游戏 "令人担忧：《信贷周刊
item.description: 在发现近 40% 的基金没有参与游戏之后，监管机构对私人信贷市场给投资者带来的 "巨大 "风险表示担忧。【原文：Watchdogs are concerned about the “substantial” risk to investors in the private credit market after it emerged that almost 40% of funds don’t have skin in the game.】

item.title: 绿科获得 7.43 亿美元信贷额度，为美元债券再融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，绿科集团已从印度国家基础设施和发展融资银行获得 620 亿卢比（约合 7.43 亿美元）的信贷额度，以寻求对海外债务进行部分再融资。【原文：Greenko Group has obtained a 62 billion rupees ($743 million) credit line from India’s National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development as it seeks to partially refinance offshore debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省港口工头向 DP World Canada 发出 72 小时罢工通知
item.description: 代表不列颠哥伦比亚省船舶和码头工头的工会对 DP World Canada 发出了 72 小时罢工通知。【原文：A union representing ship and dock foremen in British Columbia has issued a 72-hour strike notice against DP World Canada.】

item.title: 土耳其媒体赛前煽风点火，德国警告球迷
item.description: 由于德国警方警告球迷，土耳其媒体煽动民族主义热情，周六晚土耳其与荷兰的 2024 年欧洲杯四分之一决赛有可能成为火药桶。【原文：Saturday night’s Turkey-Netherlands Euro 2024 quarter-final has the potential to be a powderkeg as German police warned fans and Turkish media stoked nationalist zeal.】

item.title: 道达尔能源考虑降低部分客户的泵价上限
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）首席执行官帕特里克-普瓦纳（Patrick Pouyanne）表示，该公司正在考虑降低其法国服务站对订购该公司电力和天然气产品的驾车者的价格上限。【原文：TotalEnergies SE is considering lowering a price cap at its French service stations for motorists who subscribe to the company’s power and gas offerings, Chief Executive Officer Patrick Pouyanne said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行不能因工资和服务成本而仓促降息：穆勒
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马迪斯-穆勒说，由于工资增长和服务价格增长依然高企，官员们必须对进一步放松银根持谨慎态度。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller said officials must be cautious on further monetary loosening as wage gains and service-price growth remain elevated.】

item.title: 工党的百亿英镑危机法案只是第一个财政挑战
item.description: 英国工党自 2010 年以来首次重返政府，并承诺将立即着手实施其修复经济的计划。首先，它需要找到钱。【原文：Britain’s Labour Party is back in government for the first time since 2010 and has promised to hit the ground running with its plan to fix the economy. First it needs to find the money.】

item.title: 发现控股公司在华纳兄弟合并协议中获利 1.25 亿美元
item.description: Discovery 公司的投资者对该娱乐公司与 AT&T 公司旗下的华纳媒体公司（WarnerMedia）价值 430 亿美元的合并案提出了质疑，并达成了 1.25 亿美元的和解协议。【原文：Discovery Inc. investors who challenged the entertainment firm’s $43 billion merger with AT&T Inc.’s WarnerMedia unit reached a $125 million settlement over their claims that the deal shortchanged them and provided improper benefits for company insiders.】

item.title: 花旗银行称印度即使实现 7% 的增长也无法弥补就业缺口
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.）表示，即使经济以 7% 的速度快速增长，印度在未来十年也将难以为其不断增长的劳动力创造足够的就业机会。【原文：India will struggle to create enough jobs for its growing workforce over the next decade even if the economy grows at a rapid pace of 7%, Citigroup Inc. said, suggesting the world’s most-populous nation will need more concerted steps to boost employment and skills.】

item.title: 亚洲下半年中国和印度股市比日本更受青睐
item.description: 随着投资者涌向新兴市场主题，中国和印度的股票被认为是下半年亚洲表现最出色的股票。【原文：Equities in China and India are being touted as potential outperformers in Asia in the second half of the year as investors flock to emerging-market themes.】

item.title: 卡洛斯-斯利姆公司将向墨西哥天然气田投资 12 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥首富卡洛斯-斯利姆（Carlos Slim）控制的一家公司正在投资 12 亿美元开发墨西哥湾的一个大油田，预计将在 2026 年左右生产天然气，这是墨西哥国有石油公司与私营企业合作的一个潜在模式。【原文：A company controlled by Mexico’s richest person, Carlos Slim, is investing $1.2 billion to develop a vast field in the Gulf of Mexico that is expected to produce gas around 2026, a potential model for how Mexico’s state oil company will work with private enterprise.】

item.title: Telegram 友好链的崛起引发了加密货币超级应用的讨论
item.description: 今年加密货币领域表现最好的项目之一是一个与 Telegram Messenger LLP 有联系的项目，Telegram Messenger LLP 是 WhatsApp 的竞争对手，其区块链计划曾引起美国监管机构的愤怒。【原文：One of the top performers in crypto this year is a project with ties to Telegram Messenger LLP, a rival to WhatsApp whose blockchain plans have previously drawn the ire of US regulators.】

item.title: 加拿大保护采矿业的举措保护了收购目标
item.description: 加拿大正在加大外国公司收购国内矿业公司的难度，并采取措施保护顶级收购目标免受全球大型竞争对手的收购。【原文：Canada is making it harder for foreign firms to acquire domestic mining companies by imposing measures that could protect top takeover targets from large global rivals.】

item.title: 高价位的 S&P 500 指数在政治压力下一路高歌猛进
item.description: 在一长串阻碍 2024 年牛市的外部影响中，还要加上政治动荡。【原文：Add political turmoil to the long list of outside influences that are failing to thwart the 2024 bull market.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧盟复苏基金开始对增长产生影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧盟的复苏基金已被证明是该集团的成功故事之一，并开始在经济领域显现成效。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the European Union’s recovery fund is proving to be one of the bloc’s success stories and is starting to show results in the economy.】

item.title: 蒙蒂说：法国还没到意大利式技术官僚统治的时候
item.description: 意大利前总理马里奥-蒙蒂（Mario Monti）表示，由技术官僚领导的法国团结政府不太可能立即解决周日立法选举中可能出现的政治僵局。【原文：Former Italian premier Mario Monti said a French unity government led by technocrats is unlikely to work as an immediate solution to the political impasse that may emerge in Sunday’s legislative elections.】

item.title: 华尔街认为美元在本周下跌后重新走强
item.description: 货币策略师认为，随着政治和通胀风险重新成为关注焦点，美元一个多月来的首次周跌幅可能只是暂时的挫折。【原文：The US dollar’s first weekly loss in more than a month is probably a temporary setback, according to currency strategists, as political and inflation risks come back into focus.】

item.title: 加拿大原油价格因Suncor公司减产而上涨
item.description: 加拿大重质原油价格连续第二天走强，原因是 Suncor Energy Inc.【原文：Canadian heavy crude prices strengthened for a second day after Suncor Energy Inc. curtailed production at its Firebag oil-sands site due to a nearby wildfire.】

item.title: 加州要求选民为气候和学校拨款 200 亿美元
item.description: 今年 11 月，加州选民将有机会决定该州是否应向华尔街再借 200 亿美元。【原文：Voters in California this November will get a chance to decide if the state should borrow another $20 billion from Wall Street.】

item.title: 法国商界为投票后的动荡做好准备
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）总统决定举行临时大选所引发的政治动荡似乎将延续到周日的第二轮投票之后，这促使一些高管在法国南部的一次会议上表达了他们对该国新兴商业环境的担忧。【原文：The political turbulence unleashed by President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to call a snap election looks set to extend well beyond Sunday’s second round of voting, prompting some executives gathered at a conference in southern France to express their concerns about the country’s emerging business climate.】

item.title: 欧元集团多诺霍称市场可对财政危机做出快速反应
item.description: 欧元集团主席帕夏尔-多诺霍（Paschal Donohoe）说，如果政府突然改变财政轨迹，投资者可以迅速做出反应。【原文：Investors can react rapidly if governments make abrupt changes to their fiscal trajectory, Eurogroup President Paschal Donohoe said.】
